Title: Exploration of recommender generator system to support social learning platform of higher education institution
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems; Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Kemanggisan, Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Oktavia, T., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems; Sujarwo, S., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Kemanggisan, Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The growth of Internet technology creates many possibilities for collabora-tion between people in many areas, especially in the education field. Nowadays in a higher education institution, learning has become a complex social activity that needs more understanding of up to date trend of industries' practice because when university students graduated, they are expected to meet the standard qualification of industry. To find suitable learning partner from industry or other higher education institution is not easy. it requires connection with many partners, and the competency of learning part-ners must match with learning topics so that they can collaborate in the learning process. This study focuses on exploring how to make learning partner recommender generators that can provide suggestions for higher education institutions according to courses and course topics using information gathered from the social media platform. The results of this study are modules of a recommender system that can gather required information on learning partners from social media platforms. The modules are important for the information of learning partner's experience and skill use for making the recommender system grouping according to courses and course topics in the social learning platform of higher education institutions. © 2020 ICIC International. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Higher education; LinkedIn; Recommender; Social learning; Social media
Funding Text 1: Acknowledgment. Authors: Wiannastiti M., Sujarwo S., Oktriono K.
Title: Promoting literacy in an EFL online learning class through LMS discussion forum: A case study
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kyai Haji Syahdan no 9, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Wiannastiti, M., Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kyai Haji Syahdan no 9, Jakarta, Indonesia; Sujarwo, S., Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kyai Haji Syahdan no 9, Jakarta, Indonesia; Oktriono, K., Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kyai Haji Syahdan no 9, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The advance of invented technology has influenced the world of education including for higher education. It leases the higher education institutions offer online learning program with the specific way of teaching and learning. This paper is aimed to reveal some challenges faced by the students in an EFL online learning class, to promote literacy activities in the class and to promote how digital literacy supports EFL literacy in this online class. Responses from students of an online learning class in their Learning Management System (LMS) Discussion Forum are used to reveal their challenges in joining the class Some suggestion of activities to promote language literacy, especially English literacy are provided to give step by step learning. © 2019 Association for Computing Machinery.
Author Keywords: EFL; Literacy; LMS; Online Learning; Technology
Index Keywords: Students; Digital literacies; Discussion forum; Higher education; Higher education institutions; Learning management system; Literacy; Online learning; Teaching and learning; E-learning

Authors: Wiannastiti M., Sujarwo S., Matthew R.T., Oktriono K.
Title: Students’ writing test using an integrated-multimedia website: A case study of English professional class
Affiliations: English Department, Language Center Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Informatics Engineering, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Tourism Destination, Language Center, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Wiannastiti, M., English Department, Language Center Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Sujarwo, S., Informatics Engineering, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Matthew, R.T., Informatics Engineering, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Oktriono, K., Tourism Destination, Language Center, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Since its inception, the demand for high technology in teaching learning is escalating. Presumably, a demand emerges in assessing students’ achievement by using technology. In language teaching learning, it is undeniable that the technology is also applied in assessing students’ language skills including writing. In assessing writing, in a common type, the process is carried out manually or typed in a word document. Based on the results, this research aims to explain the development of an integrated multimedia website for assessing writing and the potential of using the website for writing test. Questionnaires were distributed to 28 students joining English Professional Course at BINUS Online Learning to evaluate the promptness of the website for the test and the students’ sense of the website functionality. The result denoted that the website contribution is well-equipped to use as a tool and to test the writing skill. Moreover, the users were comfortable to exert it for undertaking the writing test. Equally important, the developments on the website require continuous improvement, especially for the variation of the questions including to add video and audio integration eventually. © 2018 ACM.
Author Keywords: ESL; Integrated-multimedia; Technology; Website; Writing test
Index Keywords: E-learning; Surveys; Teaching; Websites; Continuous improvements; High technology; Integrated-multimedia; Language teachings; Online learning; Teaching-learning; Word documents; Writing skills; Students

Title: Building a system with No SQL approach (Case study: English writing application)
Source title: Journal of Theoretical and Applied Information Technology
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Bina Nusantara University, School of Computer Science, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Oktavia, T., Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sujarwo, S., Bina Nusantara University, School of Computer Science, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: As the complexity of business process, the need for implementing information systems also grows. A number of companies have built sophisticated system to fulfill operational. To maximize the benefit of the system, the data has to be stored in database for long time period so it can be used for analysis in the future. There are many models Database Management System (DBMS) architecture that can be applied, one of them are NoSQL architecture. NoSQL and relational model are two models that are very different. Relational model concept store data in the table, which consists of column and row. Each table interconnected by using foreign key (FK) which is an attribute. When the developer wants to consolidate data from all existing table, then the developer must combine a table with another table, through a foreign key that has defined in the first time, so it can certainly be combined data. Nowadays it’s often be problem for a developer, given the massive data growth, with a fairly high degree of scalability that will be very difficult for a developer to provide the required data in a short time. Therefore, NoSQL approach comes as a solution. In NoSQL, data will be stored in the form of documents and data integration will be done using programming language format. Each document can be likened to a programming language object that can be used in applications that are built. So that access to the data can be done efficiently and effectively despite the huge amount of data. In this research focuses on implementation NoSQL in English Writing Application based on JavaScript Platform. © 2005 - 2015 JATIT & LLS. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Data; Document; English writing; JSP; Nosql
References: (2013) Nosql Database in the Cloud: Mongodb on AWS, , https://media.amazonwebservices.com/AWS_NoSQL_MongoDB.pdf, media.amazonwebservices.com. Title: Evaluation of sub query performance in SQL server
Affiliations: School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah Jakarta 11480, Indonesia; School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Jakarta Barat 11530, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Oktavia, T., School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah Jakarta 11480, Indonesia; Sujarwo, S., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Jakarta Barat 11530, Indonesia
Abstract: The paper explores several sub query methods used in a query and their impact on the query performance. The study uses experimental approach to evaluate the performance of each sub query methods combined with indexing strategy. The sub query methods consist of in, exists, relational operator and relational operator combined with top operator. The experimental shows that using relational operator combined with indexing strategy in sub query has greater performance compared with using same method without indexing strategy and also other methods. In summary, for application that emphasized on the performance of retrieving data from database, it better to use relational operator combined with indexing strategy. This study is done on Microsoft SQL Server 2012. © Owned by the authors, published by EDP Sciences, 2014.
Author Keywords: Indexing; Performance; SQL Server; Sub query
References: Verma, A., Enhanced performance of database by (2011) IJCSMS International Journal of Computer Science & Management Studies; Gupta, M.K., Chandra, P., An empirical evaluation of LIKE operator in oracle (2011) BVICAM's International Journal of Information Technology; Connolly, T.M., Begg, C.E., (2010) Database Systems: A Practical Approach to Design, Implementation, and Management, , Boston: Pearson Education; Mercioiu, N., Vladucu, V., Improving SQL server performance (2010) Informatica Economicǎ; Channon, D., Koch, X.D., (1997) Experimental Methodology: Issues and Practice; Gillenson, M.L., (2012) Fundamentals of Database Management Systems, , USA: Wiley; Alamery, M., Faraahi, A., Javadi, H.H.S., Nourossana, S., Erfani, H., Application of bees algorithm in multi-join query optimization (2012) ACSIJ Advances in Computer Science: An International Journal; Karthik, P., Reddy, G.T., Vanan, E.K., Tuning the SQL query in order to reduce time consumption (2012) IJCSI International Journal of Computer Science; Lasya, S., Tanuku, S., A study of library databases by translating those SQL queries into relational algebra and generating query trees (2011) IJCSI International Journal of Computer Science; Lungu, I., Mercioiu, N., Vladucu, V., Optimizing queries in SQL server 2008 Scientific Bulletin - Economic Sciences, 9 (15); Mahajan, D.S.M., Jadhav, V.P., General framework for optimization of distributed queries (2012) International Journal of Database Management Systems (IJDMS)

Authors: Kurniawan A., Harefa B.B., Sujarwo S.
Title: Unified modeling language tools collaboration for use case, class and activity diagram implemented with html 5 and javascript framework
Affiliations: School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Kurniawan, A., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia; Harefa, B.B., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia; Sujarwo, S., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia
Abstract: As a result of the development of web 3.0, web technologies now make it possible for each user to collaborate in performing a task. This technology allows us to draw UML diagrams online and collaborate on a software project. Unified Modeling Language is one of the architectural modeling software that is widely used by software developers. This research aims to develop a modeling tool UML diagrams are class diagrams, use case diagrams and activity diagrams based on pre-existing web using HTML 5 technology combine with JSON Service that allows the software developer to work on the same project UML and collaborate each other with good performance more faster than ordinary web. © 2014 Science Publications.
Author Keywords: Activity diagram; CASE tool collaboration; Class diagram; HTML 5; Unified modelling language; Use case diagram
